DOC.brief_summary: The primary research aim project test effectiveness comprehensive , evidence-based vaccine promotion package implement obstetric set increase likelihood pregnant woman Georgia receive influenza and/or pertussis vaccine .
DOC.brief_title: Protecting Pregnant Women From Infectious Diseases
DOC.detailed_description: The primary research aim project test effectiveness comprehensive , evidence-based vaccine promotion package implement obstetric set increase likelihood pregnant woman Georgia receive influenza vaccine and/or Tdap vaccine delivery . A secondary research aim assess whether comprehensive package improve maternal knowledge , attitude , belief regard maternal infant vaccination . The intervention package include evidence-based component aim practice-level , provider-level , patient level test cluster-randomized trial design . The primary outcome measure influenza vaccine receipt pregnancy . The secondary outcome include 1 ) receipt pertussis ( Tdap ) vaccination pregnancy , 2 ) change maternal knowledge , attitude beliefs regard maternal infant vaccination . The primary hypothesis implementation comprehensive vaccine promotion package obstetric set increase likelihood pregnant woman receive influenza and/or pertussis vaccination .
DOC.criteria: Between age 18 50 Currently pregnant Unvaccinated 2012 2013 seasonal influenza vaccine Unvaccinated Tdap vaccine current pregnancy Under 18 year age 50 Not currently pregnant Previous receipt 2012 2013 seasonal influenza vaccine Previous receipt Tdap vaccine current pregnancy Does speak English
